INT m_record_length

Detailed Description

A DataRecordHandler can be used to load and store record based data onto a non volatile medium. Storage is organized by rows.
See also:
DataRecord

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DataRecordHandler::DataRecordHandler (  INT  record_length  ) 
 

Constructor.

Parameters:
record_length,: size of record to be stored.

virtual BOOLEAN DataRecordHandler::AddRecord (  const DataRecord *  rec  )  [pure virtual]
 

AddRecord is used to add a DataRecord.

Parameters:
*rec,: pointer to the DataRecord to be added.
Returns:
TRUE if record is successfully added, FALSE otherwise.

Implemented in NvRamDataRecordHandler.

virtual BOOLEAN DataRecordHandler::DeleteRecord (  INT  row  )  [pure virtual]
 

DeleteRecord is used to delete a DataRecord on a specific row.

Parameters:
row,: row which to be deleted.
Returns:
TRUE if record is successfully deleted, FALSE otherwise.

virtual BOOLEAN DataRecordHandler::LoadRecord (  INT  row,
DataRecord *  rec
)  [pure virtual]
 

LoadRecord is used to load a DataRecord from a specific row.

Parameters:
row,: row from which to load.
*rec,: pointer to the DataRecord (buffer) where the loaded record is stored.
Returns:
TRUE if record is successfully loaded, FALSE otherwise.

Implemented in NvRamDataRecordHandler.

void DataRecordHandler::MarkRecordDeleted (  DataRecord &  rec  )  [protected]
 

virtual BOOLEAN DataRecordHandler::StoreRecord (  INT  row,
const DataRecord *  rec
)  [pure virtual]
 

StoreRecord is used to store a DataRecord into a specific row. The row has to be already filled with a record. Use AddRecord if this is not the case.

Parameters:
row,: row in which to store
*rec,: pointer to the DataRecord to be stored.
Returns:
TRUE if record is successfully stored, FALSE otherwise.

Implemented in NvRamDataRecordHandler.
